alert.note: Alert for Crane; Pecos; Terrell; Upton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued March 02 at 1:01PM CST until March 02 at 1:45PM CST by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Midland has issued a * Dust Storm Warning for... Central Pecos County in southwestern Texas... Southeastern Crane County in western Texas... Southern Upton County in western Texas... Northern Terrell County in southwestern Texas... * Until 145 PM CST. * At 101 PM CST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from 20 miles south of West Odessa to 6 miles south of Crane to near McCamey to 20 miles south of Fort Stockton, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Near zero visibility with damaging wind in excess of 60 mph. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes Interstate 10 between mile markers 274 and 327. Locations impacted include... Crane, McCamey, Rankin, Sheffield, Iraan, Sierra Madera, Crane County Airport, Iraan Municipal Airport, Upton County Airport, Bakersfield, King Mountain and Girvin. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Dust storms lead to dangerous driving conditions with visibility reduced to near zero. If driving, avoid dust storms if possible. If caught in one, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into a dust storm. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
